Node.definition: = state in which a countable entity is three in number
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= process by which the anger (אַף) of humans and deities is aroused ◄ like a fire that is kindled
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= man; ◄ son of Barachel (בַּרַכְאֵל) ► friend of Job (אִיֹּוב)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► father of Elihu (אֱלִיהוּא) one of the characters of the Book of Job (אִיֹּוב)
= descendants of Buz (בּוּז)
= a particular group or class of either people (as in a clan or tribe) or animals (as in a genus or species) that share common characteristics
= man; ► ancestor of Elihu (אֱלִיהוּא)
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job
= process by which the anger (אַף) of humans and deities is aroused ◄ like a fire that is kindled
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= action by which humans make an effort to ensure that they are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which a countable entity is three in number
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= process by which the anger (אַף) of humans and deities is aroused ◄ like a fire that is kindled
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
literally: to find (in someone); hence: = process by which humans come upon certain information

Node.gloss: to declare guilty|to condemn as guilty
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities declare (other) humans guilty before God or humanity, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job
= man; ◄ son of Barachel (בַּרַכְאֵל) ► friend of Job (אִיֹּוב)

Node.gloss: to defer action|to wait|to lie in wait|to delay|to hesitate|to long
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities consciously remain in a particular state

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job
= state in which a human being is nearing the end of a long life
literally: days; hence: = state in which humans have reached a relatively old age

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= man; ◄ son of Barachel (בַּרַכְאֵל) ► friend of Job (אִיֹּוב)

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= state in which a countable entity is three in number
= process by which the anger (אַף) of humans and deities is aroused ◄ like a fire that is kindled
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= man; ◄ son of Barachel (בַּרַכְאֵל) ► friend of Job (אִיֹּוב)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► father of Elihu (אֱלִיהוּא) one of the characters of the Book of Job (אִיֹּוב)
= descendants of Buz (בּוּז)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
literally: days; hence: = state in which humans have reached a relatively old age
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= state in which humans are advanced in age; ≈ often associated with wisdom and respectability
= state in which humans lack confidence in the presence of other people with a higher status

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= causative action by which humans convey information to other humans
= state in which humans or deities are acquainted with facts, truths, or principles, as a result of experience, study or investigation

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: days; hence: = state in which humans have reached a relatively old age

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= marker used to affirm the truth of the following statement, which is in contrast with what was assumed to be the truth earlier on

= an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

Node.gloss: to instruct|to give instruction|to teach|to give understanding|to explain
Node.definition: = pattern of actions by which someone helps others to gain knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= state in which humans are at a relatively advanced age

Node.gloss: to be able|to be skillful|to be wise|to be intelligent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans, deities, and animals possess or gain a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= a person who is nearing the end of a relatively long life; ≈ regarded as wise, worthy of respect, and an asset to the community

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= practices that conform to the laws of God

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= causative action by which humans convey information to other humans
= state in which humans or deities are acquainted with facts, truths, or principles, as a result of experience, study or investigation

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y

Node.gloss: to look for|to try out|to test|to search out|to explore|to investigate|to examine|to cross examine|to sound out|to determine
Node.definition: = action by which someone tries to obtain information about a certain object, person, or event by examining it carefully
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y

Node.gloss: to look closely|to take note|to pay attention|to consider|to understand|to draw understanding
Node.definition: = action by which someone observes something carefully, with the intention of seeing through the outward appearance of things and grasping their essence, and so gain knowledge and understanding

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job
= action by which humans or deities express their disapproval of something with words
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: to find (a certain condition); hence: = process by which humans eventually reach a certain state or condition
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: to blow away; hence: = action by which deities inflict punishment on humans
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
literally: to bring back; hence: = action by which humans or deities respond to (other) humans or deities in a direct conversation

Node.gloss: to fear|to be afraid|to be discouraged
Node.definition: = state in which humans or animals lack inner strength and courage
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
literally: words move away from someone; hence: = state in which humans are unable to find the words to speak

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= right or opportunity of humans to partake in a particular event
= causative action by which humans convey information to other humans
= state in which humans or deities are acquainted with facts, truths, or principles, as a result of experience, study or investigation

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.gloss: to be filled > to be engaged
Node.definition: literally: to be filled (with an activity); hence: = state in which humans are fully engaged in a certain activity, either as victim or as active participant

Node.gloss: to be urged (to speak)|to be compelled (to speak)
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans experience pressure from a force within themselves to pursue a course of action
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex

= causative action by which humans or deities allow others entrance, passage, or access (in)to a building, construction, or area ◄ by withdrawing a gate, door, window, lid, covering, or other boundary; ≈ sometimes associated with freedom, sometimes with being exposed, vulnerable
= container ◄ made of a goatskin, the outer side of which has been turned inside; ► used for storing wine; ≈ known to be able to burst when too full of new wine
= state in which an object has been in existence for only a short time ◄ because of having recently been built or produced

Node.gloss: to be split|to be cleft|to be breached|to be cracked|to be ripped open|to be rent|to burst asunder
Node.definition: = process by which an object is split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans or animals open their mouth ► in order to speak
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

Node.gloss: to respect|to look upon or treat with favor|to honor
Node.definition: literally: to lift up (someone's) face; hence: = action by which humans or deities show favor or respect to someone, ◄ as if by allowing someone who is looking down out of shame or humility to look up directly into one's face
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= cauative action by which humans or deities assign a name or title to (other) humans, either to honor or flatter them

Node.gloss: to know how|to be skilful at
Node.definition: literally: to know; hence: = state in which humans have the experience, skill, and expertise to carry out a particular activity
= cauative action by which humans or deities assign a name or title to (other) humans, either to honor or flatter them
= relatively low frequency of events or short duration of an event

Node.gloss: to take away|to cause to die
Node.definition: literally: to take (someone's) away; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to die
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
